CSSAspect-ratio.summary: The aspect-ratio CSS property allows you to define the desired width-to-height ratio of an element's box. This means that even if the parent container or viewport size changes, the browser will adjust the element's dimensions to maintain the specified width-to-height ratio. The specified aspect ratio is used in the calculation of auto sizes and some other layout functions.

remarks.para: At least one of the box's sizes needs to be automatic in order for aspect-ratio to have any effect. If neither the width nor height is an automatic size, then the provided aspect ratio has no effect on the box's preferred sizes.
